result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy James R Voigt

defendant.name: Voigt, Timothy James R
defendant.address: 516 E. Main Street, Apt. 201, Watertown, WI 53094

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on November 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[MK] case called at 1:18pm 
Defendant Timothy James R Voigt appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Arguments are given on the State's request for cash bail. 
The Court reinstates the Signature Bond, with the same conditions of Bond. 
recess 1:23pm. 

NEXT: (1) clerk- add the Jefferson Public Defenders Office to the mailing matrix,  (2) Pretrial Conference on November 16th at 10:00am--only counsel need to appear, (3) Preliminary Hearing on December 6th at 9:00am
Returnable to any Jefferson County magistrate.

[MK[ cases #22CM170, #22CF299 called at 10:36am 
Co-Defendant Caroline L Heller in court.
Co-Defendant Timothy James R Voigt does not appear.
 ADA Krysta Parson in court for the State of Wisconsin.

As to #22CM170-Heller: 
--after learning that Ms. Heller applied for Public Defender representation and was found ineligible, the Court revises its decision on Ms. Heller's petition for appointment of counsel.  The Court grants the Petition. The Court will make a determination later today regarding installment payment requirements, in relation to reimbursement of attorney fees. 

As to #22CF299-Voigt: 
--the Court issues a Bench Warrant-Body Only, returnable to any Jefferson County magistrate. 
recess 10:44am

NEXT:  (1) appointment of counsel for Ms. Heller in #22CM170, (2) Status Conference in #22CM170 only on October 14th at 10:00am

Order on Petition for Appointment of An Attorney--Denied

--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription; to take prescription medications only as prescribed

[ae] cases 22CF299 and 22CM170 called 10:41 AM Defendant Timothy James R Voigt in court. Defendant Caroline L Heller in court. ADA Michaels in court for State of Wisconsin. 

As to 22CF299: The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $2,500 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription; to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no possession of any drug paraphernalia
--not to discuss the case with co-defendant outside the presence of counsel
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

NEXT: (1) Preliminary Hearing on 9/16/22 at 9:00 am (2) Status Conference 10/6/22 at 10:30 am

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

As to 22CM170: The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Pleas of "not guilty" are entered; speedy trial waived 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $1500 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no possession of any drug paraphernalia
--not to discuss the case with co-defendant outside the presence of counsel

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on  8/31/22 at 9 am  (2) Status Conference on 9/16/22 at 9 am (3) Status 10/6/22 at 10:30 am
